answer: No, never -- never in a million years.
question: Have you ever thought you were going to be world famous for cross dressing?
Are you nervous?
He had been abused?

answer: I found it out by asking questions, finally, of him, because I was talking to him --
question: How did you find this out?

answer: He told me a lot about it.
question: So, he told you?
Is he still alive, your father?

answer: We don't speak very much, but I am taking care of him.
question: And what kind of relationship do you have with him?
You support him?
Do you think despite the way that he -- he manhandled you and beat you and so on, did you feel that he loved you?

answer: -- so that was another thing I didn't know, which caused a lot of issues, as well.
question: Really?

answer: I did, about four years ago, I asked, why.
question: Did you have that out with him?

answer: I think so, because he -- in any situation, he's in tears.
question: Is he proud of you, for what you've achieved?

answer: Listen, that's exactly what I thought very early on.
question: Is that guilt, do you think?
Has he ever said sorry?

answer: At this point, I don't know if it matters.
question: Would you like him to?
She -- it -- well, you mean of all the success?
-- get her a red Jaguar?

answer: Just -- she's speechless, just a thank you and the love.
question: What did she say to you?

answer: The same as you come before me more than you go to the doctor, for a checkup.
question: How you doing?
Who you think you're talking to, old lady?
Did you ever think, when you were young and you -- you thought of treading the boards that one day you'd be world famous for cross dressing?
There are lots of other Madeas from every -- I've met a Jewish Madea, I've met an Italian Madea, you know?
Any comment?

answer: I just try -- it drives me insane.
question: You feel uncomfortable talking about money?

answer: No, who wants to show -- it's not a -- it's certainly not about showing off.
question: -- show off about it?

answer: Again, the best thing which is -- which changed my entire life was being able to support my mother.
question: What is the best thing about money, though, for you?

answer: Well, because it's -- I just feel that to whom much is given, much is required.
question: Why do you -- why do you feel awkward talking about this kind of thing?
How have you avoided the pitfalls that go with superstar fame, big money and all the rest of it?
And I say no, but it's a very particular pressure?
Do you enjoy playing the action hero?

answer: Mostly I worked with the trainers, Anthony Goldstein (ph), a great guy.
question: How did you do it?
Why?
Really?

answer: I think we were both very young.
question: And what went wrong?
It -- was it, in the end, your decision to walk away?
Do you regret that?

answer: Yes, because we both were in a place where -- and I just realized I should not have said this, because --
question: You thought it was the right thing?
Why shouldn't you have said it?

answer: It's a fascinating side to you, because you're being so nice about it and -- and so honest.
question: Why don't you ask another question?
And what's the rush?

answer: Yes, I want that more than I want to be married, though.
question: But don't you want little Tylers running around?
Should we move on?
Do you want have a glass of water?
-- were you thinking?

answer: To be honest with you, I did not.
question: Did you have any idea who she was?

answer: I -- I had heard of her, but I didn't know all of -- that she had done.
question: You'd never heard of her?
How do you know that?
You supplied the plane, didn't you?
Why not?
The first black Bond?

answer: Will Smith should be the first black Bond.
question: You reckon?
Why should it be him?
If you lose weight at the rate you're going, you'll be skinnier than Will Smith, no?

answer: There is one moment I'll -- I'll -- and I'll probably regret it for my entire life.
question: -- to give you, what would you choose?
How have you been?
-- for years, and it really dragged you down, didn't it?

answer: She told me to remember who I am.
question: When times were really tough, when you were going through that hellish period, maybe doubting if you'd ever come back from it, what did you mother say to you?
But do you ever stop and think wow, I'm still only 33 and yet I've had this 18-year career?
What's being a mother like?

answer: One of the things that I can't -- I can't put my mind around is where she really was because, you know, at the end of her life, I wasn't there.
question: Or had she just got lost in the maelstrom of fame and abuse and all the rest of it?
As somebody who still can, do you understand what that feeling must be like?

answer: I was actually in the same hotel that she passed in.
question: How did you hear it?
At the Beverly Hilton?

answer: It hit me -- it just hit me in ways I can't even explain.
question: It hit you that bad?
Are you excited about having a new album out now, with everything that you've been through in the last 10 years?
When you sing, what do you feel?

answer: Oh, my love life is great.
question: And how's your love life?

answer: We met at a studio, at a studio.
question: Where did you meet?
On this is the one you think?
RANDY: That's it?
Is there anything else you want to say?
Want to talk about world affairs?
